Sentencas: For the analysis of performance limiting processes in various electrochemical systems like lithium ion batteries, polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells or solid oxide cells, impedance spectroscopy is a powerful tool.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The distribution of relaxation times (DRT) enables the deconvolution of the polarization processes in the spectrum.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The simple approach, to correlate each peak in the DRT with a single polarization process fails for multiphase electrodes as the complex coupling of electronic, ionic and transport of different species by spatially distributed charge transfer reactions leads to a number of correlated peaks in the DRT.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: In this contribution such coupling of transport and reaction is analyzed for ceria based fuel electrodes applied in solid oxide cells.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: A physicochemically meaningful two-channel transmission line model is developed.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Due to the ambiguity of impedance spectra and DRT, the straightforward approach of fitting this model to measured spectra does not allow an unambiguous model parameterization.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Additional methods as conductivity measurements and focused ion beam-tomography are indispensable to obtain physicochemically meaningful parameters to be applied in the fitting procedure.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: With this parameterization approach DRT based modeling becomes feasible and ionic/electronic transport resistances and area specific charge transfer resistance of the ceria surface can be quantified.
Titulo: DRT analysis and transmission line modeling of ceria based electrodes for solid oxide cells
